column4: anyone know how there is no dotty screen at the startup of X in Ubuntu?
you mean before it starts to load the window manager/desktop?
yes, before loading them..
are you asking so you can make startx do the same?
oh...! I see..
no, i'm using an another linux distribution. and i would like to use it in that distro..
ahhh, well i'm not sure how gdm loads it... but i'm sure it's in some config somewhere, wherever the core X server or xinit is initialized
aha. thank you very much. i'll try to find how to set the bgcolor instead of the scary dots!! :)
it wont be in a "config" file most likely... probably within one of the init scripts itself... whatever gdm invokes when it starts up X
alright...
think i found it
/etc/gdm/gdm.conf, scroll down to "Definition of the standard X server"...
I'm there..!
i guess that's where you would change it on another distro
aha.. so i have to give some argument to the 'command' right?
yeah... i assume so anyway
alright.. thank you a lot for the help :)
where to find options for the X server, i dunno... prolly in "man X" somewhere
ahhh, -br is what makes the root window (bg) black
and i dont see any way to set a color, so i guess you're stuck with black or mesh :)
ahhhh! right, thanks. (hehe, black was also what i would do if i could select color. :D)
